Here’s a concise summary of the project’s objective based on the docs:

---

## Objective of rn-sane-charts

**rn-sane-charts** is a React Native charting library focused on **readable, professional business charts with minimal configuration**. It favors **simplicity and clarity over flexibility**.

### Main purpose

- Ship **5 core business chart types** (Line, Area, Bar, Scatter, Histogram) with **Skia-based rendering** and good defaults.
- Target **mobile-first** use cases where charts must stay readable on small screens.
- Keep the API **small and predictable** so developers can create a useful chart with little setup.
- Keep the codebase **understandable and maintainable** for OSS contributors.

### Design principles

1. **Sensible defaults** — charts look good out of the box.
2. **Limited scope** — only the “90%” charts, no feature sprawl.
3. **Skia-only rendering** in the MVP.
4. **D3 for math only** — scales, ticks, paths; no DOM-style usage.
5. **Clarity over density** — e.g. label readability over squeezing in more ticks.

### What it is not (MVP)

- No web support.
- No advanced financial charts (candlestick, etc.).
- No zoom/brush interactions.
- No data fetching, parsing, or streaming — it works only with **in-memory data** passed in via props.

### Success criteria

- Developers can create a readable chart in **under 10 lines of code**.
- Charts look good without custom styling.
- Performance stays smooth (e.g. ~5k line points, ~1k scatter points).
- Contributors can read and extend the code without reverse engineering.

### Architecture

The project is split into `@rn-sane-charts/core` (pure layout/math) and `@rn-sane-charts/rn` (React Native + Skia rendering), with an Expo examples app for development and validation.

---

-measured.width / 2 : -measured.width;\n    const baselineOffset = baselineOffsetFromTop(input.fonts.xTickFont.size);\n    return { localX, baselineOffset };\n  });\n\n  const yLabels = input.yTicks.map\n;\n}",

'',\n          points: grouped,\n        });\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const nearest = findNearestPoint(interactiveSeriesPoints, x, y);\n      if (!nearest) {\n        setInteractionState(null);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      setInteractionState({\n        crosshairX: nearest.x,\n        crosshairY: nearest.y,\n        anchorXLabel: nearest.xLabel,\n        points: [nearest],\n      });\n    },\n    [\n      interactionEnabled,\n      interactiveSeriesPoints,\n      plan.layout.plot,\n      snapMode,\n      indexedXAnchors,\n      legendInteractive,\n      legendInteractionMode,\n      hiddenSeriesIds.length,\n      clearLegendIsolation,\n    ]\n  );\n\n  return (\n    &lt;View\n      style={{ width: props.width, height: props.height }}\n}",

        "contents": "import type { SkFont } from '@shopify/react-native-skia';\nimport type {\n  FontSpec,\n  MeasureTextFn,\n  TextMeasureInput,\n  TextMeasureResult,\n} from '@rn-sane-charts/core';\n\n/**\n * Create a core-compatible &#96;measureText&#96; function using Skia text metrics.\n *\n * Core requirement:\n * - Return axis-aligned bounding box (AABB) width/height AFTER rotation.\n * - Respect the &#96;FontSpec&#96; provided on each &#96;TextMeasureInput&#96;.\n *\n * Why this adapter resolves fonts per call:\n * - Core layout can measure x ticks, y ticks, title, and subtitle with different\n *   font sizes/weights.\n * - If we always measured with one fixed SkFont, header centering and margin\n *   calculations drift from what is actually rendered.\n *\n * Performance:\n * - Font resolution uses a small cache keyed by normalized &#96;FontSpec&#96;, so\n *   repeated axis/tick measurements do not re-run &#96;matchFont&#96;.\n *\n * Rotation math:\n * - Compute rotated AABB dimensions from the unrotated width/height using trig.\n * - This is conservative (collision-safe) and fast.\n */\nexport function makeSkiaMeasureText(fallbackFont?: SkFont): MeasureTextFn {\n  const fontCache = new Map&lt;string, SkFont&gt;();\n\n  const resolveFont = (font: FontSpec): SkFont =&gt; {\n    const key = fontCacheKey(font);\n    const cached = fontCache.get(key);\n    if (cached) return cached;\n\n    const resolved =\n      matchFont({\n        fontFamily: font.family,\n        fontSize: font.size,\n        fontStyle: font.style,\n        fontWeight: normalizeFontWeight(font.weight),\n      }) ?? fallbackFont;\n\n    if (!resolved) {\n      // Last-resort fallback so we always return deterministic dimensions.\n      const defaultFont = matchFont({ fontSize: font.size }) as SkFont;\n      fontCache.set(key, defaultFont);\n      return defaultFont;\n    }\n\n    fontCache.set(key, resolved);\n    return resolved;\n  };\n\n  return (input: TextMeasureInput): TextMeasureResult =&gt; {\n    const angleDeg = input.angle ?? 0;\n    const skFont = resolveFont(input.font);\n\n    // 1) Unrotated width\n    const m = skFont.measureText(input.text);\n    const w = m.width;\n\n    // 2) Unrotated height from font metrics (ascent is typically negative)\n    const metrics = skFont.getMetrics();\n    const h = metrics.descent - metrics.ascent;\n\n    // 3) Rotate to compute AABB size\n    const a = (Math.abs(angleDeg) * Math.PI) / 180;\n    const cos = Math.cos(a);\n    const sin = Math.sin(a);\n\n    const width = Math.abs(w * cos) + Math.abs(h * sin);\n    const height = Math.abs(w * sin) + Math.abs(h * cos);\n\n    return { width, height, ascent: metrics.ascent, descent: metrics.descent };\n  };\n}\n\nfunction fontCacheKey(font: FontSpec) {\n  return\n}",
